result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry Renard McNeal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory fees, court costs and surcharges by 08-13-16 or, if not paid, serve 20 consecutive days in HOC to any sentence.

Consecutive to: Any other sentence; No Huber privileges. Court objects to ES. Court STAYED commencement until 10-13-15. If defendant provides proof of payment for OWI fine, Court will allow Huber for work and child care.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry Renard McNeal

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order GRANTING defendant's request to extend the time to pay the fine, costs and surcharges in this action, signed and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. spc

Defendant Terry Renard McNeal in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT ONE: 

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

ON MOTION OF THE STATE, COURT ORDERED COUNT TWO: DISMISSED AND READ IN AS TO SENTENCING. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve  FOUR MONTHS  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  NO  Huber privileges.Court objects to ES. Court stayed the commencment until 10-13-15.  If defendant provides proof of payment for OWI fine , court will allow huber for work and child care.  

Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory fees,  court costs and surcharges by 8-13-16  or, if not paid, serve 20 CONSECUTIVE  days in the House of Correction  to any sentence. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Terry Renard McNeal in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-13-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terry Renard McNeal in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-11-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terry Renard McNeal in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-23-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terry Renard McNeal in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 03-02-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terry Renard McNeal in court.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status ON COUNSEL  conference in Branch 47.  Defendant to go to PD's office forthwith.,  Status conference scheduled for 02-10-2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 02-04-2015 at 01:30 pm.

As an additional condition of bail:
Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
No drugs without a valid prescription
No weapons

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Terry Renard McNeal in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-015
Defendant has five cases before the court.

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 

Defendant declined to be interviewed by the Public Defender regarding eligibility informing that he may not want to proceed with counsel. 
Court orders case adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 47.
